# hitPart

**Instance Property**

A part code indicating the manner in which the scrolling should be performed.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var hitPart: NSScroller.Part { get }
```

## Discussion

This method is typically invoked by an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSScrollView] object to determine how to scroll its document view when it receives an action message from the scroller.

See [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSScroller/Part] for a list of part codes. In macOS 10.7 and later, this method no longer returns [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSScroller/Part/incrementLine] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSScroller/Part/decrementLine].

## Event Handling

- **trackKnob(with:)**: Tracks the knob and sends action messages to the receiver’s target.
- **trackScrollButtons(with:)**: Tracks the scroll buttons and sends action messages to the receiver’s target.
